zendir.connection package

Submodules

zendir.connection.client module

[ ZENDIR ]

This code is developed by Zendir to aid with communication to the public API. All code is under the the license provided with the ‘zendir’ module. Copyright Zendir, 2025.

class zendir.connection.client.Client(url: str = 'https://api.zendir.io/v2.0', token: str | None = None, timeout: float | None = 30)

Bases: object

A simple client to handle HTTP requests to an API. Each simulation ID processes requests sequentially using its own session.

classmethod create_local(port: int = 25565, timeout: float = 30.0) → Client

Create a local client with the specified port and request limits.

Parameters:

  • port (int) – The port to use for the local client.

  • timeout (float) – The timeout for requests in seconds.

Returns:

A new local client.

Return type:

Client

create_session() → str

Create a new session and return its ID. This will make a POST request to the API endpoint for creating a session. The session will be created with the provided token.

Returns:

The ID of the newly created session.

Return type:

str

async delete(endpoint: str, id: str = 'default')

Perform an async DELETE request to the specified endpoint. This will return the result of the request as a dictionary.

Parameters:

  • endpoint (str) – The endpoint to use for the request.

  • data (Optional[dict]) – The data to send with the request.

  • id (str) – The ID of the context for the client, if applicable.

Returns:

The result of the request.

Return type:

dict

delete_session(session_id: str) → None

Delete a session with the given session ID. This will make a DELETE request to the API endpoint for deleting a session.

Parameters:

session_id (str) – The ID of the session to delete.

async get(endpoint: str, id: str = 'default')

Perform an async GET request to the specified endpoint. This will return the result of the request as a dictionary.

Parameters:

  • endpoint (str) – The endpoint to use for the request.

  • data (Optional[dict]) – The data to send with the request.

  • id (str) – The ID of the context for the client, if applicable.

Returns:

The result of the request.

Return type:

dict

get_chunk_size() → int

Get the maximum chunk size for the client. This is used to limit the size of requests to the API.

Returns:

The maximum chunk size.

Return type:

int

get_version() → str

Fetch the version of the zendir package. This will return the version as a string.

Returns:

The version of the zendir package.

Return type:

str

list_sessions() → List[str]

List all active sessions for the given token. This will return a list of session IDs.

Returns:

A list of session IDs.

Return type:

List[str]

async post(endpoint: str, data: Any | None = None, id: str = 'default')

Perform an async POST request to the specified endpoint. This will return the result of the request as a dictionary.

Parameters:

  • endpoint (str) – The endpoint to use for the request.

  • data (Optional[dict]) – The data to send with the request.

  • id (str) – The ID of the context for the client, if applicable.

Returns:

The result of the request.

Return type:

dict
